pullRequest.body: Define Legendre polynomials and prove that it is integer polynomial. In the same time, its evaluation on x is equal to the evaluation on 1 - x.

nodes.body:
### PR summary [368281f0ee](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17500/commits/368281f0eed66099b21d3f6577839e9cb425615c)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.LegendrePoly`|1263|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Finsum_iterate_deriv`
`+ Legendre`
`+ Legendre_eq_int_poly`
`+ Legendre_eq_sum`
`+ Legendre_eval_symm`
`+ deriv_one_sub_X`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Can you please fix the error?

> Can you please fix the error?

it tells me that Polynomial.Legendre definition missing documentation string. I don't know how to fix this error.

> > Can you please fix the error?
> 
> it tells me that Polynomial.Legendre definition missing documentation string. I don't know how to fix this error.

Any definition must have a docstring. Just write something like
```lean
/--  `Legendre n` is the polynomial blahblah -/
noncomputable def Legendre (n : ℕ) : ℝ[X] :=
```

> > > Can you please fix the error?
> > 
> > 
> > it tells me that Polynomial.Legendre definition missing documentation string. I don't know how to fix this error.
> 
> Any definition must have a docstring. Just write something like
> 
> ```lean
> /--  `Legendre n` is the polynomial blahblah -/
> noncomputable def Legendre (n : ℕ) : ℝ[X] :=
> ```

thanks for suggestion. I have fixed the error.
@riccardobrasca  hello, riccardo! Can you review my PR and give me some suggestion? please!

> I don't have time today for a serious review, but why not working with polynomials over `Q`?

ok! I'll fix these error. Sorry to bother you, I thought you forgot. Then I'll wait for you.
ok. I'll push iterate derivative of finset sum first.
I don't have time today for a serious review, but why not working with polynomials over `Q`?
I don't have time today for a serious review, but why not working with polynomials over `Q`?
Here `k` and `h` should be explicit. Also, this lemma can go to a more basic file.
ok! ok!

```suggestion
    rcases Int.even_or_odd n with (hn1 | hn2)
```
Maybe even `n.even_or_odd` if it works.
We usually do proofs using `by_cases`.

This lemma does not seem to be specific to Legendre polynomials, right? Please call `#find_home! <lemma_name>` below it, to find a good place.

Note that `Finsum` is a different concept from `Finset.sum`. So the name should also be updated.
ok!

I am a bit confused. This suggests that the coefficients of `Legendre` are integers. According to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legendre_polynomials#Rodrigues'_formula_and_other_explicit_formulas some coefficients are fractions with a power of two in the denominator.

Are these different definitions of the Legendre polynomials?
emmmm. oh! By this wikipedia, the polynomial which is defined may be called shifted Legendre Polynomial. Maybe the name which I used was wrong.
I see. So let's rename these to `shiftedLegendre`. And could you then please make them polynomials that by definition take values in `\Z` instead of `\R`?
ok! I have fixed by your suggestion. I'll push it after I push iterate derivative of finset sum.

pullRequest.title: feat: Define shifted Legendre polynomials and prove some basic properties
